description:
Delicious, hot, quick Chinese food with generous portions. I can order 2 plates and have plenty of leftovers for lunch the next day! 
The restaurant itself is cozy - my husband and I will pop in occasionally to get away from the cramped apartment, or I'll stop by in between jobs for a fast and filling meal. The (male) host I've encountered is very kind and attentive. The Mongolian beef/beef with mushroom are my go-to's! Consistently flavorful. 
Some dishes are a little on the bland side, but nothing a dash of soy sauce won't fix! 
Their crab rangoon filling is awesome with a garlicky touch. I'm serious about my crab Rangoon and this stuff is the bomb~~~ 
Prices are hella decent for the area, can't wait to try more of their menu items and combos.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The Combo Claypot - Came out smoking hot, it was the hottest (not spicy hot but the temperature hot) food I've ever seen. It was burning even after 20 mins . 

It was delicious though . The spice level, meat ratio to rice was perfect. It's a lot of good food for that price. Would visit again to try their other specialties.
author: Keerthi C.

description:
Huge portion of food. I got the Combo C which comes with beef, fried shrimp, steamed rice, two egg rolls and a side of salad.  Yum Yum.  The egg rolls were crispy and so were the shrimp. Affordable prices too especially for San Francisco.  

I like this restaurant because I can get both my chinese food and Vietnamese food fix right next to my apartment.
author: Hailey C.

description: For the Combo meals, they really are a bargain. I ordered thru grubhub.com. I got Combo C Combo for $10.50 made of 2 egg rolls, fried shrimp, salad, BBQ beef and steamed rice.  I also ordered potstickers and thai iced tea.  Nothing disappointed me.  They were all hot to the touch, all fresh.  If you wanted hot, the combo had a mini spicy hot sauce cup along with the regular Vietnamese thin red vinegary sauce.  The hot sauce went well with the 2 big egg rolls(with bits of meat and full of noodles inside).  The 2 fried shrimp were well-battered.  The BBQ beef was small in portion but cooked ok.  I liked everything I ordered and with the affordable price, especially DOWNTOWN with the megaprices surrounding us everywhere, I can't give lower than 5 stars!!  I'll remember where to go for those Vietnamese food cravings!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
Yum very good. Good pho. 

I woulda drank all the soup too but I didn't want to food coma.
author: Alvan C.

description: For the price, the food was so good! The portions are really big, and our waiter was very friendly. I got the chicken noodle soup, and my girlfriend got the veggie fried rice, and it was all very decent. The price was also especially good, as noted, and especially compared to everything else in SF. If you're looking for a low-key night out, give this place a try!
author: Arya B.

description: I used to frequent this place when I worked nearby. I usually get the combo claypot. I really love the crispy rice the claypot makes.
author: Carlos C.

description:
It's a great place to stop by for lunch especially if you are craving Chinese or Vietnamese food! Everything is within a good budget so your wallet won't cry. I come here at least once or twice a week and mainly get pork chops, pho, or anything that I'm craving. Their portion size is so generous and is enough to keep you full for breakfast, lunch, and dinner! 

Customer Service could be improved a little. I once ate at the restaurant with a friend and our server went on their lunch break without telling us, so it was kind of awkward to go up to her and ask for the bill. All the other servers were also on lunch break sitting together so it was a strange situation. Overall, this restaurant is here to stay!
author: Polly Q.

description: Food delivery for couple of times via Grubhub...not bad. Big portions on the food, enough fish sauce and even included lots of good thick napkins. They ran out of French roll today but called to lmk and asked what I prefer to substitute (considerate!) ordered beef stew, tomato beef, grilled pork and shrimp vermicelli, eggplant with fish and five spiced roasted chicken. Looks good!
author: Vee V.

description: I ordered here on July 16th but never got my order and when I tried to call about it I didn't get any help getting a new order sent out or a refund. Sucks I'm out 30$ and never got my sesame chicken :(
author: Norwood P.

description:
I don't know about anything else here but their satay beef pho is pretty damn good. Expected just walking out of here not pissed off but pleasantly surprised. 

No picture, was so good that just hit the spot. Thought I give them a thumbs up there
author: Frank N.

description:
I am not impressed with this place. I ordered:

1. Chicken Pho 
2. String green beans
3. Shrimp rolls

The pho broth was bland and tasteless. They didn't bring any of the fixins besides basil and bean sprouts, and the noodles weren't vermicelli-they were flat, wide rice noodles. Pho real?! The whole purpose of my order was for the pho.

The string green beans were also quite bland. I had to repurpose them to add more flavor. 

The shrimp rolls had pork in it. This is not indicated on their menu, so when the delivery guy asked me if I was ok with eating pork, I said, "no" he took them away. I'm not sure why they wouldn't just call me prior to making or bringing the order to ensure I was ok with pork, if they are going to make the effort to ask when they show up (also twenty minutes late). I appreciate that the delivery guy told me though, instead of letting me find out on my own.

I'm not much of a complainer, but when you're sick and you order something specific you want what you order to show up. I'm sure you can relate. At least the string green beans were decent after I added some spices etc to them.

I was pretty disappointed with my overall experience with this restaurant and that I did not really receive what I ordered.
author: Shereen A.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE! I normally don't eat Chinese food because it usually doesn't agree with me afterward, but I decided to try this place. I ordered about $30 worth of take-out food (potstickers, combo fried rice, chicken chow main, and sweet & sour pork). It was tasty, fresh, and my stomach agreed with it! The portion size they gave me was good for three days worth of food for a single person. With all that food, at $10 a pop, that actually agreed with me, I call that a bargain, and will definitely be back.
author: R J.

description:
I gotta say it's my favorite local hole-in-the-wall Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant! But you have to take it for what it is, stereotypes and all.
I have tried: Combo Clay Pot ($9) MUST TRY, Combo Chow Fun, Combo Fried Rice, Hot and Sour Soup, Asparagus and Crab Soup. TBH any of their entries, noodles, rice, or clay pots are  winners. Avoid their soups or appetizers. I have not tried the pho yet but would caution against eating pho at a restaurant not dedicated to it. 

(1) Located on 7th and Mission-- there is literally no parking around in these SF streets. Also it's kind of a sketch area with odd characters. Stay safe!

(2) Service is typically, nonexistent aka true badboy Asian style. It's family-owned and they're ALWAYS busy. Employees dress casually and are attentive however. But don't expect them to share the Specials of the Day or to engage you in friendly, caring conversation.

(3) Food is on fleek-- homely, comforting, and tastes like chalkful of MSG/salt! I mean I downed my water so often but the chicken is always my fave protein FYI can't get enough of that dark meat mm. Beef is also chewy and probably velvetized/baking soda, but still tender.

(4) Prices are reasonable ranging from $7 - $10. They have increased their prices to an additional dollar since last year though. 

(5) Delivery and Eat24 and Cards. They do delivery but always account for an hour and maybe longer during lunch rushes. They also take cards and don't have a minimum hallelujah.

Overall, the quality makes me happy for a local mom 'n pop shop. It's more delicious and does not taste like Panda Express cardboard. But it's not high-end quality either and tbh sometimes the hole-in-the-walls make the best homely foods. Cheers to 7 Mission!
author: Donna T.

description: Decent price, decent food, quick & easy. Just run of the mill, cheap and cheerful chinese food. The kind you see and taste in every neighborhood of the USA.
author: David J.

description:
The seafood soup here exceeds most others in the area. lighter broth than Tu Lan and better noodles, plus way more seafood, fish balls, fish cake, and it is definitely not sitting around before you order it (the fish cakes haven't decomposed).
 
The clay pots are the real draw here and very filling. I tend to go with the seafood options as well.

Not the best Pho bo or pho ga in the area. many others within walking distance.
author: Mike V.

description: Dunno about the Vietnamese food but it's pretty standard Chinese restaurant stuff.  The clay pots - the combo and spare ribs, especially - are greasy, but generous and roundly satisfying.
author: Emily Z.

description: Typing this as I'm waiting for a delivery order from 7 mission :) Good food.  Great prices.  The same guy who works there everyday is super nice too.  Combo claypot is a must try.
author: Chi N.

description:
I ate here with a coworker who recommended the clay pot. 

Vegetarians, you can order a veggie version of the clay pot, even though it's not on the menu. 
Unfortunately, I went with the tofu and veggie rice plate. The meal was ok, but pretty bland. That said, I definitely don't mind a generous serving of fried tofu. The service was quick, and the prices are cheaper than many places around ($7.50 for a generous serving of white rice, tofu, and veggies). I may return to try the clay pot, but there's plenty other restaurants on my list.
author: Jenna F.

description:
I've been coming here for lunch almost a month straight because it's quick, it's cheap (~$11 tax/tip out the door), and close to my work. I really want to give it "4 stars" but this place just falls short even for what it is.

My most disappointing moment came the other day when I ordered a usual favorite - the spareribs claypot. The spareribs had a strange unfresh taste to them that I really did not like - this is a dish I've ordered at least 5 times before. I really hope that this was an "off day".

The other dish I usually order is the pho, and I am also unsatisfied that the pho sometimes comes without jalapenos to spice up your soup.

The portions are generally huge, but the consistency is lacking. Sometimes dishes have come very salty, other times they're perfect. Sometimes things taste incredibly fresh - other days like my claypot it is so questionable if it was even safe to serve.

The problem with the slow service is largely fixed if you just walk up and pay. I have short lunches and I simply aggressively flag down a waitress, order, and when i'm done I flag them down right away or just walk straight to the guy behind the counter and pay - there's no reason to wait and nobody on the serving staff is going to be offended at this "mom and pop" hole in the wall.

Your impression will improve also based on what you order. I recommend you stick to certain basic rice plates any Chinese place makes (mongolian beef, kung pao, etc), claypot dishes, and pho (in that order) if you want to leave happy. Ordering anything that doesn't get a lot of "rotation" is risky in my opinion, lol.
author: Doug R.

description:
This places offers good food and low prices as An excellent choice for hotel visitors and neighbors alike. The good is authentic San Fran Chinese with some Vietnamese selections including Pho. The portions are generous maybe even enough for the late night snake or lunch tomorrow.

A small dining room with approximately 10-4top and 5-2top seating. 

I'll be back. 

Thanks to Kristina from the hotel across the street (Best Western Plus Americana) for your recommendation.
author: Miss T.

description:
Standard Chinese place.
I ordered the beef chow fun and it's the kind of chow fun that only has beef and no vegetables. It was just the right amount of grease and aokay amount of food, a little on the small side.
author: Mimi T.

description:
We stayed at the Carriage Hotel next door and arrived late.  So we just ate close by.  

We had the sweet sour chicken with rice.  It clearly is a meal for more than 1.  It was rather good and didn't have a lot of fat on the chicken.  In fact, I don't remember even tasting any fat.  We also had the chicken soup and it was "ok".  Honestly we found more beef than chicken in the soup.  We didn't ask the server to fix it because he didn't speak that good of English.  We just went with it.  We also had hot tea and this is where it got WEIRD.  They gave us our hot tea in a plastic water cup.  What the heck?!?  Waiter never checked on us and we needed refills, napkins.  

We ate inside and I have to say there was a few kids running all over and screaming.  It honestly looked like they knew the owner.  They were there before we got there and were still there when we left.  I love kids but my kids would not be acting like that and if they did continue I would leave with them out of respect for the other patrons.
author: Chris E.

description:
I catered from 7 Mission several times for events, and let me tell you, their serving size is CRAZY HUGE!  Their fried rice is delicious, so is their chow mien! Very reasonably priced! 
I love 7 Mission!
author: Jasmine H.

description: Went to this place for lunch, sat there and watched the waitresses mingle while I waited, then, a white couple walks in, they IMMEDIATELY sit this couple down with wide smiles, BOTH OF THEM, serve them water and take their order when I came in minutes BEFORE them! Needless to say, I IMMEDIATELY got up and left this place! I cannot spend my money with people who serve DISRESPECT! This will be THE LAST TIME I COME HERE!
author: Isaac S.

description:
Absurdly cheap for clean table service dining in SoMa + Fast service + Super courteous staff + Great food quality for the money + its technically Fusion for all you foodies (aka Chinese / Viet)

I live around the block and love coming here when Miss Saigon gets busy or if I am feeling impatient. The waiter is super attentive, the delicious food comes out fast, the cheap check gets settled quickly. They have great Chinese and also Pho for Asian SoMa yuppies, kinda like how hood Chinese joints serve fried chicken.

Personal Note: I love the nostalgic 80's style pizzeria seating, reminds me of childhood
author: Roger L.

description:
Decent chinese food place close to Soma

When I first saw "clay pot" on the menu outside the door, I was excited. Damn! Even though I wasn't hungry, I Just had to go in and try it.

From the menu, the food items looked legit--spare ribs clay pot sounded authentic. Unfortunately this was not the case--the whole thing did not really taste like authentic clay pots. There wasn't a lot of soy sauce, and the rice was mixed with carrots (what??), onions, and bok choy. Which is fine--I applaud them for adding ingredients, but that's not how authentic clay pots are supposed to be! It's supposed to be just spare ribs, with rice, and lots of soy sauce! That's how they make them on the streets!

Oh well, at least the price was pretty good. The decor inside looks like a fast food place, which is not bad.

All in all, a pretty good place to stop by if you're looking for a quick meal and decent tasting food.
author: Henry L.

description: Ordered sesame chicken rice plate online and it was ready in 10-15 minutes. A very large portion for $8.00 and loved the flavor.
author: Jocelyn E.

description:
Been here a couple times, it's definitely not one of those restaurants that you would tell your friends about. Nothing outstanding on the menu you'd want to go back for, just mediocre Chinese and Vietnamese food. A lot of options to choose from on their menu, decent prices for soma. 

Clay pot rice with chicken - bland and oily. Basically a pot of plain rice in a pot topped with a few pieces of meat. 

Chicken pho - subpar, broth is bland. Definitely would not order the pho here again. 

I would suggest ordering their rice plates instead. I think they're around $7.95 and they give huge portions. 

Five spice chicken rice plate - their roasted five spice chicken has great flavor! Also comes with a few pieces of broccoli on the side

BBQ pork rice plate - huge portion of meat and rice, it was pretty good for the price 

Overall, just decent. Would not go out of my way to come here,
author: Carmen G.

description: Love this restaurant prices aren't as high food is good quality. It does get pretty busy at lunch time so it's best to call ahead and order.
author: Naleia A.

description: Good food with reasonable price. Perfect for quick lunch or quick bite. you can also order online as well
author: Sal S.

description:
Place is small & not crowded. Service is good. I ordered Pho with rare steak & meatballs while my friend had the pork rib clay pot.  

Thai tea was delicious & thirst quenching. The pho will fix any pho craving. The clay pot was delicious and looked like it was the local favorite (since everyone inside ordered one).
author: Gayle D.

description: The prices are amazing and you should definitely come here if you are broke do not skip this if you really want good food for a good price
author: Angel R.

description:
Let's face it. This is not a fancy shop. But it has decent Chinese food. 
I love my food boiling hot and spicy and this shop is one of a few places can offer that. 
Acceptable price and good dishes (close to my hotel as well). Can't complain!!!
author: Giang L.

description: This place has one of the best chinese food San Francisco has to offer. Their potstickers are A-class. Their set plates are cheap and good value for price. It cost us around $10 for the set plates. There is a variety of choices between beef, chicken and seafood. The place is not very fancy but like most chinese food places.
author: Fatema M.

description:
This is my first time trying out something at this restaurant. This review is just for take out. Ordered on the phone and picked it up in 15 minutes which was pretty quick. I got the beef and string beans rice plate. The food is pretty decent and the price is cheap. Big portion that I couldn't finish which I will save for dinner! 

If you looking for a cheap Chinese food restaurant if your in the area, I would say give this place a try! I would order again from this restaurant!
author: Louise C.

description:
Should of done this a long time ago. I absolutely love this place. Always good food, nothing ever changes. When we don't order to go or delivery we eat there and it's always a good experience. Nice people and good food! 
I always have their shrimp spring rolls...my favorite. The soups are just as delicious too. I like the chicken salad it's nice and fresh and lite. Crab rangoons are a must as well as their chicken wings.
author: Annette S.

description: The first two times I ordered from here, the food was really good! Today, however, the food was gross. I got the scrambled egg with beef and the meat was gray! We also ordered the potstickers which were not anything to write home about unlike the past times we ordered them. My co-worker also ordered the seafood chow fun and said that it seemed off and he began to feel sick eating it. I'm not sure what changed with this place but I will never order from here again.
author: Bernadette B.

description:
I feel like I give half my paycheck to this business every month, I kid you not. It's conveniently located right around the corner from me, and with such affordable prices (everything is under $10), who has time to cook in this city?

It's never crowded, and they're always super quick. It literally takes them just minutes to complete an order. And even though they close at 9pm, they've always accepted any online orders I've placed at 8:59pm. They're also pretty good with special requests/modifications.

Having sampled practically everything on the menu by now, I can't say anything has ever been bad, but here's what I recommend, and what I find just passable -

Get -
Potstickers
Anything with double mushrooms
Any claypot
Five spice roasted chicken
Combination fried rice
Chow mein/fun

Pass/Just OKAY -
Curry
Pho
Crab rangoon
Any chicken dish where the meat is not deep fried
author: David W.

description: Inexpensive but tasty chinese and vietnamese food in the culinary wasteland that is SF's Civic Center area.  Dining in is more fun than taking out (they have claypot stuff!) but they are incredibly efficient and organized with takeout.  Large portions, though light on the vegetables, with savory comfort food goodness.  Also they have canned grass jelly drink which is like a quick cheapo boba tea in a can.  (Shake vigerously before drinking however, as the cans appear to have sat for several years before being served..)
author: nate p.

description: It's not superior Chinese food but for convenience and the price, it's my go to place. They have a good variety of food and the people there are nice. The food comes out fast and for a lunch break, it works.
author: Alfred K.

description: I've been there once before and just thought it was "meh" but I must have ordered the wrong thing ("wet" beef chow fun).  I just ordered a rice plate, and it was quite good.  Not bad at all.  Glad I gave them another shot.  The rice was overly abundant, but the chicken/eggplant was a good portion, too.
author: Patty W.

description:
I ordered. Food came in 10 minutes. This is what you call chinese fast food.

I was super hungry and I didn't feel like going out so I decided to order in despite the terrible ordering experience last time. I expected to wait around 45 minutes but 10 minutes after ordering the food came. I ordered the spare ribs clay pot rice, vietnamese coffee, and some other stuff not worth mentioning. I was off of coffee for awhile but I saw the Vietnamese coffee on the menu and buckled because I'm weak and I love coffeeeee.

Recommendations:
Food: Get Clay Pot Rice : http://bit.ly/yummyclaypotrice
~or~
If you're confused/fickle you can order one of their combination dishes that have egg rolls, fried shrimp, salad, and a choice of ( BBQ beef, BBQ pork, 5 spice chicken) with rice. 
Drinks: Vietnamese coffee : http://bit.ly/vietcoffee

Vietnamese coffee: 4 Stars  - perfectly strong
Service: 5 Stars  - Fast delivery and super friendly
Food: 3.5 Stars  - Decent take out food. It won't knock your socks off but the best if you're in the area.
author: Jennie C.

description:
I have a job in SoMa where I can't leave the office and often times this is the only reasonably priced spot for Vietnamese delivery I can find! The food is always prompt (today it took 23 minutes). I tried their Vietnamese coffee for the first time today, and it arrived with the ice cubes all in tact. The coffee is amazing, its not sickeningly sweet and it has a nice body to it. 
I crave imperial rolls and nuoc mam 24/7 and this place delivers. I love their prepared fish sauce! you get a lot of rolls for the money! All of the other food I have tried is good. I recommend their Vietnamese options as the Chinese options I have tried tend to be bland. Overall, a solid choice for some Asian food in SoMa.  Would I choose to go here if I could leave work? No, there are better options. But I always enjoy the food they deliver.
author: Sunshine R.

description: Love the Sesame Chicken and the fried rice! Great service and quick delivery.
author: Demimonde Mesila Thraam X.

description:
I was craving some pho and decided to give this place a try.  There were a few open tables when we arrived so they seated us right away. We ordered imperial rolls, vegetarian pho, 5 spice chicken and bbq pork plate. The imperial rolls weren't horrible,  but I wouldn't order them again.  The pho waa piping hot and all of the veggies looked and tasted very fresh. Squeeze some sriacha into it and it's perfect.  

Hubby had the bbq pork and liked it a lot. The girls shared the 5 spice chicken and finished the whole plate. Serving sizes are very generous here. 2 sodas & 2 waters and our tab was under $30. What a steal. This might just be our new pho spot.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I am really glad I live near this Vietnamese place. Must've been here dozens of times in the past couple years. The food is cheap and most dishes are solid, and the guy who runs the place is super friendly!

---- SOUPS ----

Chicken Pho: 5 stars
My favourite chicken pho I've ever had, with perfect firm springy noodles, delicious broth and tender white chicken meat.

Vegetarian Pho: 4.5 stars
The same delightfully tensile noodles, with a healthier broth lacking the chicken-salt from the chicken pho. Contains bakchoy, broccoli, bamboo, black mushrooms, cabbage, celery and I added tofu.

Satay Beef Noodle Soup: 5 stars
Today I was looking for a hearty soup because this winter has put an interminable chill in my bones that clear pho can't drive off, so I tried the Satay Beef Noodle Soup for the first time... New favorite dish!! It is so yummy and has all the fatty beef tendons and thin-sliced lean meat you could want.

Asparagus and Chicken Soup: 4.5 stars
Another comforting dish for cold nights.  It's an egg drop soup with soft curds of yummy protein floating in the thick glazed soup.

Chicken Curry Soup: 2 stars
The only one of their soups I didn't like.  The flavour is a little weird, maybe too much curry powder.  The best Vietnamese chicken curry soup I've had so far is at Sunrise Cafe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sunrise-cafe-san-francisco-2) on Bryant St.


---- DRY DISHES ----

Beef with Eggplant: 5 stars
Chicken with Eggplant: 5 stars

Chicken with Double Mushroom: 3 stars
Sauce has a weird artificial flavour.

Claypot rice dishes: 4.5 stars
Delicious and SO much food for what you're paying.

Five Spice Chicken: 4.5 stars

BBQ Pork with Imperial Rolls Vermicelli: 4.5 stars
The BBQ pork comes in thin strips reminiscent of bak kwa (Chinese BBQ pork jerky), but these imperial tolls are deep-fried, crunchy and packed full of good flavour.

Crab Rangoon: 2 stars
All the crab here is imitation crab.

---- DESSERT ----

Three Colour Bean Dessert (Che): 3.5 stars
This is a layered drink similar to Filipino Halo-Halo or Singaporean chendol -- red beans topped with green (mung) beans topped with jellies in white coconut milk. Unfortunately, I grew up on coconut and bean desserts, so this does not meet my high bar. The green bean layer is delicious, but the jellies are too weak and disintegrate with no "muscle" in your mouth, and the texture of the liquid is gritty / chalky instead of the smooth coconut milk desserts I've had in Vietnam and Thailand. But if you're craving a Southeast Asian dessert then this might well suffice to scratch your itch.
author: Letitia L.

description:
oh... My... WHHHATTTTT?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?

I've been craving Chinese food for DAYS, but I've been just admiring the photos of them on yelp, hoping the visuals will satisfy my craving (I am trying to get in shape. OBVI). 

But today, I COULD NOT take it anymore, and had to take action.

I thoroughly browsed through Chinese restaurants around my area for the last good hour of work (don't tell my boss plz), and determined that my victim of choice will be 7 Mission Restaurant. 

Looked through photos during my commute home, and got myself thoroughly ready for dinner.

Walked in the restaurant, took a quick glance at the menu - and ordered the Combo Clay Pot.

A few minutes later... my clay pot came out. 
The nice mr.server set it down in front of me, grabbed the lid, and opened it after a split second of pause.... it was almost theatrical. 

I could almost hear the gong going off.

An Immense amount of steam was immediately released, fogging my iphone camera lens that I had ready to instagram and snapchat this magnificent bowl of food.

Undeniably, it was love at first sight.

I admired my steaming pot for a good minute, took some photos, and started digging in. THat's when the clay pot took me to a whole another LEVEL.

I forgot about everything. I don't care where this chicken came from, or the mushroom, the rice, the shrimp, the sausage. The perfect medley, the balance of flavors, temperature and texture were enough to send me over the edge.

The pot stayed sizzling, piping hot throughout the duration of my eating session, and the jasmine rice had formed a perfect crispy bottom to add some extra fun to my meal.

The server was really nice, and had a smile on his face the whole time.

I KILLED the entire meal. I'm so full I'm having trouble sitting down and typing up this review. 

All that. for $7.55+tip. 

I'm ready for bed now. I'm going to have good dreams.
author: Alexis P.

description:
Never thought to review this place as it's quite unremarkable, but I've been here so many times for lunch that I thought I'd give it a quick mention. I work about a block away and find this an easy option to satisfy my spring roll cravings which incidentally is what I order here almost every time. The spring rolls or "salad spring rolls" are unfortunately not that cheap or salads, but they're cheaper than any other meal I can grab in the area and just the right amount of food for a quick small lunch (for me at least). The dish (actually an appetizer) comes with 2 rolls that are cut in half each and filled with vermicelli noodles, assorted salad, shrimp, and some bbq pork (note: not vegetarian!). The rolls also come with a delicious peanut sauce that I like to add the chili sauce they put on the table. They're in no way life-changing spring rolls, but they seen fresh and hit the spot (and come on, this dish is pretty hard to mess up).

I've also once tried their sesame chicken rice plate, which I do not plan on ever ordering again. The rice was bland and dry. The chicken itself was mostly fried batter and covered in a goopy yellow sauce that was extraordinarily sweet and otherwise flavorless. To be honest, this dish has pretty much discouraged me from trying any other plates. 

Overall this place was very mediocre. The restaurant itself felt cramped, dark, and uncomfortable which is why I have always ordered as pick-up. As a result, I cannot talk about the service. The sesame chicken rice plate was... worthy of a 1-2 star rating, but I keep coming back for their spring rolls so I guess I'll give them 3 stars.
author: Vivian L.

description: I live a block away from this place and order take out at least twice a month. The food is good. Nothing too special about it. Unfortunately, they use imitation crab meat for the seafood dishes which I despise. Staff there are helpful,though you might need to flag them down because it gets really busy during lunch hours.
author: Anna H.

description: I am updating my review because the issue that led me to decrease my star rating no longer exists.  For that review there was one very young lady who I felt provided very poor customer service mannerism.  Now the lady that I've seen working the tables for lunch the last few times I went is very nice and courteous.  On top of that I always like going there for their BBQ pork dried vermicelli.  Though pho is the emphasis, there are Chinese-food items to be ordered too (plus, the staff speaks Cantonese).
author: H K.

description: Solid Chinese food. I'm a huge fan of the chicken fried rice -- it's the spot every time, and the price point is good too. Only gripe is that it seems that chinese restaurants in San Francisco don't offer duck sauce! I'm from the east coast, and duck sauce is at every Chinese restaurant -- alas the reasoning for only four stars.
author: Marques R.

description:
Holy! hot dam we have a winner. One of my fav. Food dish on this planet is imperial egg roll vermicelli noodle bowl. This place got it the best that I've had so far. Details as follows for delivery:

Chicken Fried Rice (Instructions: white meat chicken only please and spicy please): this was interesting, it had the consistency of Japanese fried rice (fluffy, not a lot of oil and what oil used was peanut or a light veggie), it's was ok but there should have been some bigger flavors, there weren't, but I thought it was a pass. 

BBQ Pork and Egg Roll - Rice Noodle (or called imperial egg roll vermicelli noodle bowl): This place has the best noodles that I have ever had, now that might not seem like a lot, but to a noodle fiend like myself you can taste the difference. Theirs are fatter, thicker, and soak up sauce way better (plus they strain better so you don't have soo much water at the bottom). The BBQ pork was the most tender thing that I have ever ate, Mississippi smoked BBQ included. Honestly, my only beef with this is that the wrapping for the imperial rolls are not the glass wrapper dough (like they use for any salad roll). Easy way to tell this is if your eggroll is brown/tan it's normal wanton wrapper, it is a dirty white -- you got glass wrapper, which gets crispier. 

Shrimp Salad Roll (2): IT HAS BBQ BEEF IN IT. They don't tell you that, I am. I liked it, my vegetarian GF did not (and it was her order), more food for me. The ravager wins again.  

Corn and Crab Meat Soup: We both tried this and gonna have to pass, it's an egg drop soup with some imitation crab, and some veggies, stuff is in it, but not the most fantastic thing ever. But, then again, if you're a vegetarian you gotta be pretty much used to that now huh?

Egg Rolls: Pork, carrot (nice addition), some dikon, with wan-ton wrapper. Good, and if you dip them in the vinegar chili sauce great addition.
author: Max X.

description: This is a great spot. Great food and reasonable prices. The atmosphere isn't the greatest, but that doesn't matter if all you're looking for is a solid noodle bowl.
author: Gareth P.

description:
I stumbled across this restaurant because it was so small that I almost missed it. As a result I got curious and went in for a visit. A couple of revisits later, I can say that I'm duly impressed.

The restaurant itself is very small. The decoration is not exactly all that good. But the family cooks with the type of down home earnestness rarely found nowadays. The food is not Michelin Star worthy, of course. But their prices are absolutely excellent (most menu items are under $7 FOR very generous portions), especially in comparison to some of the restaurants in Chinatown where the average dish is smaller but is priced at more than double, sometimes even quadruple the price of 7 Mission's dishes.

The place is not in the best part of town for sure. But as another reviewer said, if you happen to be staying in the Best Western Carriage, Best Western Americana, and the Good Hotel, then this place is literally 10 steps away from you.
author: Henry J.

description:
I come here on weeknights when my bf and I have to work late. We always get the combo clay pot. Love the crispy rice. And we get the chinese sausages and shitake mushrooms in there.

The staff (one guy) is always smiling and the only one taking care of the front of the house work. He's always in great spirits.

They have one tv in the back. Usually what is on, is what I like. I've watched Giants games here, the Obama State of the Union address, and other major life events on this tv.

This is straightfoward, no fuss chinese- much like the chinese culture(my people). I haven't ordered anything but the combo claypot and don't plan to.

Neighborhood seems shady in some places, but all in all, the place is always at least 50% full with a bunch of others ordering takeout. If that doesn't say it, I don't know what will!
author: Clara T.

description: Super low key, good food and friendly customer service. I also saw that they served beer, good to know. But I went on for their pho. Loves it!
author: Joba B.

description: Cheap, no-frills, super Americanized Chinese food (haven't tried anything on the Vietnamese part of the menu). Takeout is usually really quick (bonus points for being on eat24) and everything is really reasonably priced.
author: Roshan S.

description:
This is your classic neighborhood Chinese take-out joint, and I'm very grateful to have it in my neighborhood. The prices are super decent - so if you're expecting a classy joint, do yourself a favor and go to TEO or M.Y. China - maybe they'll offer the kind of culinary experience you seek, especially if you're a tourist.

If you just want some quick, tasty food, this is the place to get it. get value. The staff here is very friendly, and they process take-out orders VERY quickly.
author: N. R.

description: Foods are in good portion and reasonable price. We ordered entrees and rice for a family style. I like our fresh rolls with peanut sauce, eggplant with fish. BBQ pork is awesome and I love their wonton soups (just sprinkle some black pepper) but I don't like chicken with pineapple much cos its very soggy and bland. We got there after the Giants parade when they're busy but we stayed until there're two tables in the house. I didn't take long for the foods to get ready despite that they're busy.
author: Yanakon D.

description:
Only ordered delivery, so can't speak to the service or decor. The prices were cheap, like most Chinese restaurants.

Hot and Sour Soup: A large serving, with the right amount of thickness, sour/spicy kick, crunchy vegetables like wood ear, and meat. Surpassed my (admittedly low) expectations. I just wish they hadn't filled it with scallions. I hiss at scallions

Mongolian Beef Rice Plate: For the boyfriend. Disappointing. Wayyy too many onions = way too much onion flavor. Inexplicably cooked in a sweet sauce reminiscent of "orange chicken" (*shudder*). The beef could have been more tender

Satay Beef Noodle Soup: For me. :) Noodle soups are my favorite food and satay is one of the best sauces ever invented. Satay beef noodle soup is not difficult to make, which is part of its appeal, as it never fails to satisfy me. 7 Mission's version had that delicious, spicy, savory satay broth I love so much and the beef was quite tender. It was also packaged well for take-out
author: Josephine L.

description: I went here with a work group and the food was just not very good. I got their vegetarian chow mein, which had absurdly large pieces of veggies and lacked taste overall. By the time I "finished", it didn't look like I had eaten anything since I left behind the large piece of vegetables and (tasteless) tofu. I also ordered the imperial veggie rolls, which also did not have much taste. The sweet and sour sauce they brought with the rolls was essential glorified ketchup. I wouldn't recommend this place for its food, but the prices are low, so if you're desperate for a bite, it's okay.
author: Vishnu R.

description: My brother recommended I try this spot since it's near my home.  I ordered take out and the food was ready In 10 minutes and prices are good.  The potstickers were really good.  The beef chow mein was ok and the broccoli beef was not good but not bad either.  If I go back I'll order the potstickers and the chow mein. Service was good.
author: David S.

description: A great place for a bowl of beef or chicken pho but their "Vegetarian Pho" is made with CHICKEN stock and is therefore NOT VEGETARIAN. The two times I had the Vegetarian Pho I found pieces of chicken in the soup. When asked, the server said that it is made with chicken stock. The menu should not mislead vegetarians into thinking that they are not eating meat. Again, great place for carnivores, not great for vegetarians. To the business: especially in a progressive place like SF, please label your dishes properly.
author: Charles D.

description: gets the job done. a nice option in an otherwise expensive dining section of San Francisco. Service is good too.
author: Jessica M.

description:
If you are in a hurry and want something quick and easy 
Defintily stop by Get their combo clay pot rice (very hot)
Portion was good
Service was quick
Nothing to write home about !
author: Mochi A.

description:
They food is really good but the service is horrible that why its a 4 and not 5. I eat her often. I don't recommend coming in around lunch time. You can never get a seat or you will be waiting about 2min for one. Every time I come i get the same thing which is the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice and a cup of water. Ok now this is why i say the service is horrible. When trying to get a refill of WATER it takes about 15 min unless you wave you hand around like your trying to answer a question for middle school. They need a little improvement on going around at least every 5 min just to check and make sure everything is ok. 

Overall the the food is excellent.

Did I mention CHEAP!!??
author: Kristell B.

description: Feeling little under the weather.  So figured I'd hit up the pho spot. This place has a very good broth not lacking flavor like some other places I've been. There general chicken is tasty over rice hit the spot. I got the asparagus chicken pho added the Sriracha  if you're down here give them a try .
author: Sal L.

description: Shittier version of Panda Express. Gave me the wrong order, which would be fine, but it was gross
author: B H.

description:
I live right across from this place and I've turned into quite a regular. This place is great for a few specific dishes like their sesame chicken, potsickers, or beef curry (or at least those are my favorites). I tried deviating away from those and let's just say the quality definitely isn't there across the board. 

Despite that this really has turned into my go-to place for cheap asian food. I order online and walk over to pick up. After my second order the person at the counter, remembered my face and at this point just hands me my order when I walk in. Always great to become a regular.
author: Tahsin I.

description: Our go to place when we're looking for delivery, no experience with dine in. Everything here is great, great value as well.
author: Zack P.

description: Ordered a bowl of beef stew pho & it literally came with only 1 piece of beef stew & 6 pieces of fatty pieces. & when I told the girl that there wasn't enough meat, she gossiped to her coworkers and didn't do shit about my meal. I love their food but that bowl of pho was some bullshit
author: Alyssa P.

description:
I don't mean to be a harsh critic but the service here is totally lacking. My coworkers and I went here yesterday evening before happy hour and were astonished we had never tried it before. It's basically around the corner from our office. 

I ended up ordering the beef and scrambled egg, and my coworkers got the chicken and bok choy and the chicken with green beans and rice. The food was okay. I actually thought that my dish was INCREDIBLY salty and the fact that the waiters failed to give us glasses of water did not help. I thought a dish as simple as beef and scrambled egg would be solid tasting. But I was left disappointed with my salty dish. 

My coworkers also complained about the saltiness of their dishes as well. I don't know if I'll be going back here but if I do I should have the sense to try one of the claypot dishes that other yelpers have recommended. And my only other reason for coming back would be the close proximity to the office. However, if the claypot fails me then I will not be returning. 

Slow service, right on 7th street by Civic Center, little parking, hole in the wall

Oh I forgot to go into detail about the slooooow service - it took about 30 minutes to get our check after we were done eating. And no water for us either.
author: Paula V.

description:
Cheap food for the starving stomachs. Tried the spare ribs clay pot - not bad but just barely acceptable.

update: their bbq beef rice and chicken wings are actually pretty good. beef chow fun is fine but a little bit too salty & greasy. personally I would not recommend their clay pot to my friends.
author: Chenguang W.

description:
I'm only giving 3 stars cause the food isn't bad, and prices are cheap!

Now, for the service.. Pshh!! The don't even deserve one star for their service.
I walked in, no one greeted me so I just sat myself down and looked at the menu,
My waiter walked at least three or four times pass me before acknowledging me. After 10 minutes waiting for someone to service me, my waiter with a bad attitude and a bitch face took my order. Btw! No water or utensils were given to me until I asked it! 

Anyways, satisfied with my food, I waited another 15 minutes for my waiter to take my plates away and give me my check, she was literally in front me drying spoons and forks. She definitely saw I was done cause she looked my way about five times.

I didn't wanna cause a scene so I didn't go off. She whispers to her co worker, they both look at me then her co worker gives me the check. 

The only reason why I go here is because the food is good and it's very close to my job. 

They really need to give that waiter a reality check on customer service!!!!
author: D N.

description: I've mostly been sticking to the soups and appetizers so far, and those have been very tasty. Their delivery people are great.
author: Edgar P.

description:
I was wondering for while about this little place... Every time I come from work...
I had the BBQ pork disk on Saturday afternoon. It wasn't full , but there were some interesting people sitting in front of me.. I made a request for brown instead rice. White rice make u fat...
I found the pork to be  very delicious, and they serve it with steam broccoli and slice of carrot..
I had to order extra pork" Cuz I eat a lot" I wish they add more pork instead of too much rice..
author: Pedro D.

description: Pork and shrimp rice noodle was soooo good, so is crab meat and eggs soup!  Chicken was a little dry.  Forgot to ask for receipt, I called after got back to hotel and they texted me a pic of it right away, very responsive and helpful.  Recommend!
author: Christina S.

description: Love this place. Clay pots are awesome. Wonton soup and their Pho are perfect. Be early for lunch or order online because this place is SUPER busy for lunch during the workweek.
author: Irving S.

description:
Clay pot ricks!
Rice is crusty on the bottom and lots of food for reasonable price.

I have not tried anything else there, but the clay pot makes me happy.  I get excited thinking about going and everyone always says how good when I take them.

Happy clay pots here!  Enjoy!

I was going to go four stars as the ingredients could be better quality, but very few meals make me this happy so five stars it is!
author: Larry W.

description:
Free delivery with a $20 minimum through Grubhub. Took about 45 mins,

rare beef noodle soup - pho bo
good broth, definitely hit the spot. I would ask for less noodles next time. They didn't automatically include Hoison and Sriracha sauce. sad life

fried shrimp - i would not order this again. the batter was orange and the taste was odd. couldn't be drowned in sweet and sour sauce.

pan fried noodles - def needed to add sriracha and a tad bit of soy for more flavor

all 3 items + tax + tip  was less than $25
author: Lisa N.

description: Super fast delivery! Beef satay pho was amazing and we really enjoyed the shrimp salad rolls and egg rolls.
author: Brandi Z.

description:
Really good, hardworking people who give you large portions for cheap prices. Pho is good. If you're eating in, I recommend some of the clay pot dishes. 

Unlike other Chinese restaurants, their food is not salty, so ask for soy sauce and hot sauce. Definitely a go-to place if you're in soma and on a budget but don't want to compromise taste.
author: Vy T.

description: Pretty disappointing. The food came promptly and was hot, but the Sesame Chicken was just really not what I expect Sesame Chicken to be. It was soft and wet, without the crisp shell that sesame seeds provide. And the sauce was kind of meh (tasted like sweet and sour sauce) and made the greens wet and droopy. I'll probably give one different dish a try and move on.
author: Luke W.

description:
$6.50 for lunch special here. They offer a huge seletion on the lunch special menu, all of which look really good. They had either a tofu or eggplant lunch, but not a combo and had problem combing them to make one lunch when I asked. Really fresh food, loaded with MSG and tasty sauces.

The Salt and Pepper Fish is not on the menu, but I was able to order it and it was just okay. The batter was too thick and it could have used more seasoning.
author: Camille R.

description:
This is a review of delivery from 7 Mission Restaurant.

Easy to order via  http://eat24hours.com/

Delivery - The order was placed at 12:15 PM.  The order was delivery at 1:00 PM.  That is a delivery time of 45 minutes.  There is no delivery fee.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

Order Minimum  - It is relatively high ($20).

Packing - The food was packed into clam shell containers.  There was some slight leakage but it wasn't overly messy.

Mongolian Beef - This was very bland.  Even the hot sauce I requested only helped a little.  The meat was tender.  The vegetables were relatively crisp.  The portion was large.

http://tinyurl.com/44938ab

Chicken with string beans - It had very little flavor.   I did not find the flavor that it did have enjoyable.  It may have simply been personal tastes, but I did not like the taste at all.  The portion was large.

http://tinyurl.com/3zzg9rm

BBQ Beef Sandwich - This was also very bland.  The meat had no flavor at all.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp though.  The roll was a pretty good roll.  It was dense but it worked.  I would not order the sandwich again though.

http://tinyurl.com/3nalnna

Price - Their prices are pretty good.  The entrees including rice come in at around $6.

BBQ Beef Sandwich - $4.25
Chicken with Spring Bean - $5.95
Soda 3 $1.25
Mongolian Beef = $6.25

Subtotal: $20.20 
Tax: $1.72
Total:   $21.92 

Fortune Cookies - They did not provide fortune cookies.  Argghhh, I hate it when I do not get a fortune cookie with my Chinese food.

Overall - For my tastes, their food is just not as good as many other Chinese restaurants.  The service and the costs are good though.
author: Mark D.

description:
It's the most authentic Chinese place in the SOMA area. The prices are extremely good too. I normally stick to the beef chow fun or claypot combo. 

Best dish: Claypot Combo 
Food: 4/5 stars
Ambiance: Authentic Chinese (kinda dirty feeling)
Price: 10/person 
Service: I like the people that work there, they're very friendly.
author: Kevi L.

description: I love their combo claypot, a meal in one pot, crunchy, chewy, with lean Chinese sausage, a little of everything-rice, chicken, chinese mushroom.  Once it arrives, do not mix, leave it alone.  Let the crispyness cook a bit longer.  Have an ice Vietnamese coffee and there you have it, my last meal on earth.  Unless, I also order the Pho with Satay Beef.  My stomach will be so full I probably can't move any way, so why try to move.  I'll get stuck in one of their booth and I need the "jaw of life" to cut me out.  Don't mind the service.  It's the thought that counts.  In this case, it's the food that counts.
author: Helen L.

description:
I live right around the corner from this place and I've been here quite a bit. The service and some of the food is a little hit or miss. They get everything out to you super quick though. Lemon chicken and sesame chicken are the way to go in my opinion.

~ TheWaterGuy
author: Daniel T.

description: Fast service, good food for reasonable price.
author: Pauline I.

description:
Tried them for the first time yesterday and thought they were okay. 
I didn't realize the items on their menu were rice dishes--which means reduced portions and mixed in with the rice. 
Nevertheless, the food was inexpensive and the delivery was fast. Good on a rainy night when you want something quick.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Friends, I can't really review on much other than their quick service and their excellent claypot!  I'm not sure it worth trying anything else.  I always get the veggie one and ask that they keep it in the oven a little longer to make the rice nice and crispy on the bottom (maybe it's a Persian thing and if you are Persian or know a Persian, you'll know what I'm talking about).  It's usually busy, both at the restaurant and the phone going off - these are all good signs when there are so many choices in SF.  The only warning is, sometimes a really crazy person might walk in (rare but I go enough that it's happened twice since I've dined there).  They have never been rude or disrespectful to the person but try to handle it the best they can.  Usually they leave without weirdness and I appreciate that.

Again, CLAYPOT.
author: Zin M.

description: I don't know what they think Mongolian beef is, but what I was served certainly wasn't it, they also saw I gave back a full plate of food, and didn't offer anything else.
author: Andrea J.

description:
Russ, Jason, Kien, Zaw, and I went to this place for one thing, and one thing only - clay pot rice.  we were on a straight mission to find clay pot rice and thanks to yelp we found this place.  

Fair warning to true clay pot rice aficionados - this is more like fried rice in a clay pot as opposed to genuine clay pot rice.  Although it's not 100% clay pot rice, I still liked it.  

We paid $7/pop for rice in a clay pot with your choice of toppings.  mine came with chinese sausage, chicken, and mushrooms.  Now in a normal chinese place, it would take up to 30-45 minutes for clay pot rice, so you can imagine my shock when it came out in 10 minutes! My theory is that they took rice, fried it, topped it, then put it in a clay pot and put it in the oven.  i can tell it was in the oven cause there was some rice sticking to the bottom of the clay pot and it was sizzling when it came out.

My other clay pot mates said it was good, and cheap, but not legit.

I would definitely go back.  not for tube steak though. just for the clay pot rice
author: Ray R.

description:
Since my bf lives close to this restaurant, we go there for the sake of convenience whenever we don't have anything to eat. The food there is okay. It's a little bit oily for my taste. 

For dessert, three bean dessert has pretty strong coconut flavor to it. Like it has really really thick coconut milk.
author: Fong C.

description:
You know in tv shows when all the characters sit around and eat chinese.... well if my life was a tv show, this is where our food would come from. This is a staple in our household. The food is delicious, cheap, and quick. Usually delivery is about 60-75 minutes and we generally get it around 50-60 minutes (it's close to where we live, but not close enough to walk to pick up).

Plus it has chinese and vietnamese options... aka the only place I know of that will deliver pho!

Our favorites...
-Shrimp salad rolls (heads up... these have pork in them so not for vegetarians/pescatarians)
-Beef noodle soup
-Chicken chow fun
-Curry chicken rice plate
-Wonton egg noodle soup
-BBQ pork/shrimp vermicelli bowl
-Cashew chicken rice plate

Explore the menu. lots of good stuff to try :)
author: Margaret L.

description:
I've eaten here a few times as it's pretty close to work and lunch spots in this part of SOMA are far and few.  I can't tell if the resto is more Chinese or Vietnamese as they serve both but their food is decent.

So far, I've had their Won Ton Soup w/Noodles, which was good but it didn't have pieces of chicken or pork like others spots serve it up but, it fixed my craving, not sure I'd order it again though.  I've also had their Salt & Pepper Pork Chop Rice plate.  For some reason at the time, it was served to me warm, borderline cold but the steamed rice was piping hot.  There was a good, lunch sized portion of pork chop, which was tasty, could've used a little more pepper and jalapeno but, that's just me.  Their Mongolian Beef Rice plate was decent, my only complaint, which is common for most every Chinese resto I've been to is that they load it up with veggies, the red peppers, green peppers, green onions, onions and just a few pieces of beef.  By the time I was done, all those veggies were what was left on the plate.

They serve you hot tea automatically but sometimes you have to ask for it.  I've ordered their Vietnamese Iced Coffee twice which was a nice treat to end my meal, not to mention, to keep me awake for the rest of the day.

Service, just like the tea, is hit or miss, but overall has been friendly.  The resto itself is seriously a hole in the wall, it's not somewhere you'd go with a group or celebrate a special ocassion, it's seriously just to eat and run.

Overall, it's not the greatest Chinese/Vietnamese food out there but, it's a nice spot if your craving rice in this neighborhood.
author: Nick D.

description: I love this place! Staff is friendly, and food is cheap and gooood. I can eat here every day but I don't know how healthy it is. But so far I've ordered their BBQ Pork salad and their BBQ Combo and they were really good. I'm gonna be coming to this place alot!
author: Song Z.

description: The food is just okay. Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour pork, and claypot combo are tasty and popular. I usually go here because its close to my job and convenient for lunch. Its also reasonably priced. The cashier (male - sorry I don't know his name) is super nice. If you are on a budget (SF prices) and wants something quick, go here.
author: Casey P.

description: Food arrived warm and fast! Placed my order at 8:30pm. Arrived at 8:50pm. Wow. Food arrived hot. Ordered beef pho noodle soup and veggie fried rice. Happy camper.
author: Ali M.

description: Food is pretty oily and the food taste depends on the cook but overall everytime I go here the workers are very nice and I get my food within ten minutes max! Very nice staff and they remember me when I go to order the same thing.
author: Jessica W.

description: This is my go-to chinese delivery spot in soma. I usually order for myself & coworkers always tag on their order. Their food is fresh & tasty. Not the best chinese food ever, but for delivery the taste & portion size can't be beat. My usual order is the veggie chow fun. Loads of wide noodles with fresh veggies. I also really like their tofu salad. It's super yummy. Their prices are very reasonable. Their delivery service usually takes an hour minimum, so be sure to plan ahead.
author: Amber G.

description:
Terrible!  We ordered our food at 8pm and it shows up 2 HOURS LATER at 10pm.

Driver also gave us the wrong order, so now we're out $30 and have a pile of gross beef we're not going to eat.  Awesome.

A great place to order from if you don't mind wasting your money and time.
author: Des M.

description:
This place gets my vote. Pho is excellent! And food makes your tummy say Mmmmm. The staff are very nice. 

Note: Don't go here with picky eaters. Get what's on the menu. Don't ask to make substitutions, just eat the delicious meal prepared for you.
author: Charliena B.

description:
Yeah okay, decent food at moderate prices. It lacks a little character in the dishes to really stand out. Seems like they are a little stuck between Chinese and Vietnamese. I wish they'd show a little more creativity and dedication to the dishes.

Mostly great because it is rather on the cheaper side, takes credit cards, and (at least for me) in a convenient location. No big fail, yet rather a place to grab a cheap lunch.

Staff is sometimes a little overwhelmed when it gets crowded here but always friendly. Free tea is definitely a plus.

Just checked the latest health score inspection result: 68 - not that great. I find it a little sneaky that I have never seen the actual score hanging in the restaurant anywhere. Hope they improve again.
author: Tin Yan C.

description:
I've been here twice. The first time was great, it's a nice, cozy place with good service and an extensive menu with an excellent price tag. Their potstickers are really good and way cheaper than anywhere else I've seen. The sweet & sour soup is really tasty. I'd been meaning to review the place before, and if i'd done it after my first visit I might've gone with 3-4 stars.

HOWEVER...my second visit. *shudder.

I just placed a pickup order, got to the restaurant to find everything packaged all nicely and ready to go. I get home...started eating my soup, when I notice this odd-looking soup component in my bowl that, upon further investigation, turns out to be a ROACH. 

Yes, a roach. Little antennae and all.

In. My. Soup. (ew ew ew ewwwww)

Thus heralds the end of what was going to be a beautiful relationship. I really don't think I could go back without wanting to puke.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Went here for dinner tonight and was completely satisfied.  I had the Mango Chicken on a bed of rice for $5.95.  The taste was right and the price was right.  Food was ready in less than 10 min.  

I'll be back.
author: David S.

description: At a hotel and order food for delivery because I have a 1 year old and it's dark outside.  Food was decent and prices are fair. Food came up to 24 something & tip the driver 5 bucks although he correct me and told me that it should have been 6 something. Which took me by surprise.  A tip is gratitude. If anything it took over two hour and a half to get my food. Idk if driver deserve more than 5 bucks as tip
author: Vickie H.

description: On gloomy school days, I come here for Pho, as its just a block away from school.  Its not the best, but its not that bad either.  The price is acceptable considering their location ($7), plus they take credit cards, so I gotta give them that.
author: James R.

description:
I've tried all sorts of stuff here because I live soooo close and I'm super lazy when it comes to cooking. Most of the items they have are average tasting and affordable so you really can't go wrong (compared to other Chinese takeout places where only a few dishes are acceptable and everything else is SO wrong). My favorites would probably be the beef pho or their combo fried rice. However, even as my favorites, they are still pretty average so don't expect the flavors to blow your pants off or anything.

This place is a solid 3 stars but I'm upgrading my rating because they can feed me within 10 minutes of calling and I know that, no matter how adventurous I get with the menu, I will always be satisfied and full.
author: Amaryllia L.

description: Good for a fast and cheap eat.  But I found a hair... The curly kind... on my egg roll... Check it out.  Will I return? Uh I don't know...
author: Dee Y.

description: This place is the best place for Chinese food in the neighborhood,  but it's average at best. The place is usually full during lunch, which is definitely a good thing. My only complaint is that they sometimes forget to make my order when I order online through Eat24.
author: C B.

description:
This place is our go to spot when we don't want to hassle with parking or we want delivery. The food is more of a 3 star A Ok rating. The pho is solid and they have a wide variety of other dishes that are actually Chinese versus Vietnamese.

Here is why you get the extra star. When you get delivery and they say it'll be there in 30 to 35 minutes, it actually arrives in about 35 minutes. In all honestly of ALL the places I've every ordered from in SF this is the only place that actually delivers in 1. under an hour and 2. delivers with in the time specified. The other week we ordered from a Chinese place less than a mile away (yes we were that lazy) and it was an hour and a half to get our food.

So yep this place gets bumped up one star for that. Oh and they guy who answered and took our order actually understood what our order was with ease. Delivery guy also had no problems. Usually the delivery guys will call us and not even try the call box. It's SF. It's condo's and apartments everywhere. Seriously you don't know how to use a call box. Delivery experience was soooo easy with 7 Mission. It's a reason why we keep coming back here.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Maybe 3.5 stars!  

This restaurant has been here for quite some time, and even though I've walked passed it nearly every weeknight on my way to the BART station for the past 10+ years I've never set foot in the place until recently.  With the crazy economy and some of my regular SOMA lunch spots disappearing by the week I've been frequenting different places to add to my lunch rotation.

So I've eaten here twice in the same week mainly because they've received some fairly positive Yelp reviews, and if just based on my two visits I don't think this restaurant makes anything that is super special, but they do make some basic Chinese and Vietnamese selections quite adequately with good flavor, good portions, very good service and very minimal MSG.

I went the Chinese route on my first visit with an order of potstickers (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/9Jm1NnEVGg4_ivoKN0Bq4g/l) and a beef chow mein (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/CldM-w2MV-hFiYVOrxFmRg/l).  The potstickers had a very thin skin much like Japanese gyoza and were crispy on the edges.  The predominantly pork filling wasn't quite moist enough and was a bit oversalted.  The vinegar and soy dip definitely helped in masking some of that salty flavor.  I liked the chow mein more as the beef was only slightly tenderized and there was plenty of fat chow mein noodles.  I'm not a big fan of the thin, crispy Hong Kong style egg noodles so these fatter flour noodles were definitely preferred.  They keep the fillers such as onions, bean sprouts and shredded cabbage to a minimum so there was quite a bit of beef and noodles in the dish.

For my second visit I decided to try some of the Vietnamese offerings with an order of the deep fried vegetarian imperial rolls (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/t9nE6RWt7_BS4MfgXEGfww/l) and a vermicelli bowl [a.k.a. bun] with grilled pork (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/BKm8IHGphKxaXFbjXlyo1A/l).  The imperial rolls were quite good with its filling made up of silver noodle thread, shredded carrot and cabbage.  The rolls were fried up to the point where the cabbage was actually creamy.  They left out quite a number of ingredients from traditional bun dishes.  There are no bean sprouts, cucumber, cilantro or fresh basil in 7 Mission's version.  The bottom layer is simply shredded iceberg lettuce.  The portion of cold vermicelli noodles was quite generous though and the grilled pork while sliced bacon thin was very flavorful.  Finely minced peanuts and sweet pickled carrot finished up the dish.

The service is very friendly, and while the food doesn't come out of the kitchen lightning fast the wait is quite short.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Really didn't want to rate since it's such good food and I don't want a line.  But they deserve it.  Best service,  best food.  I do lunch.
author: fritz k.

description:
This place is just all right. They don't do much in the way of spice. The fried rice is weak. If you can't get fried rice right, it's not a good sign. 

Service is speedy and friendly. 

The icewater tastes weird. 

Nothing wrong with this place, just nothing spectacular to recommend it either.
author: Bill G.

description: This is an okay restaurant to get Vietnamese vermecilli noodles. However, my dad ordered the beef stew and the beef was hard to chew. I would rather walk a few blocks to Little Saigon than coming here for Chinese/Vietnamese food. The egg rolls are small and the food is only so-so.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Meh waayy too oily. I know Chinese food is oily but there was enough oil at the bottom of the box to bathe a person in it.
author: Wanda M.

description: Minimalist Vietnamese and Chinese sit down and take out.  The vegetarian rolls and vegetarian pho were good if wholly unexceptional.  I reckon this is a quick and decent choice for folks in the general area.
author: Tom M.

description: I've had better, it was alright. the prices were fair. The utensils were dirty, so we requested plastic ones. Don't think I would visit a second time.
author: Paola W.

description: I've been back many many times since my first review and this place is now my go to spot for quick, cheap, and tasty chinese/vietnamese food. The combination clay pot is delicious. Also, surprisingly the PHO is really good as well. I'm usually skeptical getting pho at a hybrid restaurant but this one definitely passes the test.
author: William L.

description: Their shrimp spring rolls are made fresh every time it gets ordered. I love getting that as appetizers, a long with their egg rolls. The prices here at this restaurant are decent, and is not to expensive.Really get your moneys worth.
author: Krystal S.

description:
It's a bit suspicious that they serve Vietnamese AND Chinese....but I live one block away so tried it out. 

I was very underwhelmed. Food was bland, just OK...not the worst ever, after adding tons of spices and sauces to everything the noodles tasted alright. The shrimp fried rice is made with the most microscopic shrimp ever, like larval stage shrimp. 

I give it two stars because the people who work there are nice and accommodating.
author: Hilarie S.

description: 7 Mission is the go-to restaurant for the best chicken pho and spring rolls with peanut sauce. Drip iced coffees are a favorite and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. We go at least once a week for take out. Great place!
author: Rob P.

description:
10.23.10

Warning: don't come here wanting/needing pho.  You WILL be disappointed.

Waltzed in Sunday morning in (somewhat) desperate need of MSG soup with noodles.  Except, they're out of pho noodles.  They're out of flat rice noodles.  So to improvise, we were served spaghetti in our "pho".

Oh, I'm fancy.

One of the few times I did not feel better after noodle soup.  Fail.
author: Jenny L.

description: This is a pretty good lunch spot. I love the spring roll. Sweet and sour pork. I noticed that the clay pots are very popular. Its a hole in a wall kind of restaurant, it gets pretty packed during lunch. The prices are very fair. And there are a lot of items on the menu to choose from.
author: X X.

description: For the price, 7 Mission is awesome. I always go for the Mongolian beef with brown rice. It's solid and is my go-to meal when i don't want to spend much.
author: Zac A.

description: Fast delivery, we order lunch there and our team is always excited and pleased.
author: Ana R.

description:
Average pho.  

The go to plate at this place is #104, Combo Clay Pot.  Hits the spot every time.  For under seven bones, you get shrimps, chicken, mushrooms, and lap cherng (chinese sausage), over rice.  Eat in is better than take out by far for this plate.  Definitely a very large serving.
author: Sam T.

description:
They keep the hot side hot and the cold side cold...though I am sadly not talking about the dearly departed McDLT from McDonald's. God, I miss that burger. No, I'm talking about how they pack up the pho (noodle soup) when you order it to go.

They have the broth and the hot ingredients in a Styrofoam liquid container, the cold noodles are in a little burger-type container and the bean sprouts and hot peppers are in a little baggie. It's quite an operation, but it works. You put it all in a bowl at home, and it can be pretty tasty especially if your fridge only contains a piece of moldy cheese and a half-empty Diet Coke bottle.

I usually have the $5.50 Curry Chicken Noodle Soup which has a couple of chicken pieces (still with the bones) bathing in a curry-infused broth. But they offer the usual suspects when it comes to Chinese and Vietnamese dishes - lots of rice plates, chow mien, even BBQ sandwiches.

I have to admit none of the food I've had is all that outstanding, but it ain't disreputable either. It's perfectly decent for a quick meal, and since it is technically my neighborhood Asian restaurant, I come in here often to make orders to go. I can't remember the last time I actually sat down and ate there though.

FOOD - 3 stars...decent, just decent
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...a lunchroom...though they gussy it up during the holidays
SERVICE - 4 stars...really nice and attentive
TOTAL - 3.5 stars...if you're in the neighborhood
author: Ed U.

description:
Each time I've gone here I've noticed a definite lack of freshness and taste to the food.  I kept hoping that one day the food I ordered would ignite my taste buds.  Alas, no such luck.

At best, I'd say the food was edible.

I would suggest you make the walk out to Larkin and find a restaurant that serves good food.
author: Dan B.

description: This small restaurant serves good food and above average prices. I guess it is because they do not receive many customers so they have to inflate their price point. The staff were more interested in taking my order so costumer service could been improved. Overall a decent place to eat.
author: Michael N.

description: I think it's best to order 'noodle' based dishes from here and stay away from appetizers or any rice plate.... Delivery was 40 min which was great, but food was seriously lacking. Never been here and tried to play it safe with spring rolls potstickers lemon chicken and chicken chow mein .... I could only eat the chow mein, everything else was gross-- way to much fish oil, soggy rice, weird spring rolls - sauces were bad.
author: John O.

description:
I haven't seen pho this cheap in a long time... but with a cheap price tag, you can assume that you get what you pay for. I can't really muster any comment for the pho except "OK", in that it is okay in every way: the noodles are not too soft or hard, the broth has taste but nothing too special, and there is ample meat per bowl.

But with that cheap price tag comes smaller portions. I was less than full after finishing it, and to me, there's nothing worse than not feeling full after a meal. The cheap price is nice, but I would have gladly paid a little more to have the right amount of food.

Otherwise, come here if you need a quick pho noodle fix. The staff is very. very nice, attentive and quick. Just don't expect anything above average.
author: Jason W.

description: The best Pho I have ever had in the city! I've been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. Great authentic food and great service. Love the BBQ beef, Pho, clay pot, and yellow curry. Yum! You definitely need to try this place. My favorite hole in the wall restaurant.
author: Angelique F.

description:
It was a walk by find- looked in, saw people were inside and grabbed a booth. Service and food within 10 minutes. $6.50 netted a steaming cup of tea, and an enormous bowl of plain vermicelli noodles with beef. I loved it-  they had sauces that I could mix and match as well. 

New neighborhood favorite
author: B S.

description:
It's cheap and they deliver.

YES!

However, I did not enjoy their Combo B plate.... too salty. But, go for the Pho. You just cannot go wrong.
author: Karry D.

description:
My new favorite spot!

First night in the city, looking for some good Chinese or Vietnamese food that delivers and ended up running across 7 Mission.  This place over delivered!  First of all, the plate was a healthy portion.  I ordered garlic chicken with rice and my wife got some pho which I must admit was some of the best pho I ever tasted.

To top it off, their prices are amazing.  I don't think anything was over $6.50.  I will definitely be ordering normally from here.
author: Robert S.

description:
Fast delivery and pretty good prices, but not very good food.

Everything I ordered was extremely greasy. I mean, for egg rolls you kind of expect that, but there was oil literally DRIPPING off, like they didn't even bother to drain them.

The five spice chicken didn't taste like anything except fat. I also found a nickle-sized chunk of bone in it.

The crab rangoon filling was actually really good. Lots of crab, little filler, not too sweet. However, there was barely any filling in the dumpling, which kinda cancelled it out.
author: Dani A. C.

description: affordable and tasty.  jip you on the meat tho.  release tha meat gahdammit.
author: Erwin S.

description: I go and I go frequently, but only because it's right by the job and they take my card with no minimum. The Pho is less than impressive, but I do enjoy the "satay beef noodle soup". I don't see that item in many other places. Rice plates and appetizers are average. Overall rating, less than average.
author: Helen L.

description:
A simple little spot for a quick Chinese fix without having to make the trek out to the madness of SF Chinatown. With a mix of Chinese and Vietnamese dishes all for under $10, there really isn't much to complain about this place. Only waiting a mere 5 minutes for the food to come out, I was utterly surprised. Clean, cheap, & quick - that's all I ask for when I'm in dire need of food.

Ordered the sweet and sour fish + rice dish minus the veggies (because all I really wanted was the fish) for only $6.50. The portion was large enough to fill up 2 people, and even though the flavor was nothing spectacular, it's definitely a bang for your buck. A tad overloaded with batter, the fish was only mediocre, but I was stuffed after just a few bites. They also offer combo dishes for about $7-8, which includes eggrolls, meat, and rice. Pretty good deal, if you asked me.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's a nice spot to check out if you're in the SoMa area and you don't want to throw down a lot of bills on dinner.
author: Michelle W.

description: Most of the menu is under $10 and I'm more than satisfied with what I get - portion and flavor. I can't complain about their service because they're quite polite to me and my husband. As well, they're quite reliable with Seamless orders.
author: Catalina C.

description:
Good solid spot for inexpensive, but decent Vietnamese food. I had a vermacelli bowl, and it was tasty, good balance between vermacelli and meat (and egg rolls). Nice spicy/sweet sauce. 

Great price.
author: Maxwell P.

description:
Here's the deal. I was on the way home from work and decided to try this little Chinese-Vietnamese place on 7th and Mission. I called them when I got off the bus. The told me it would be 10 minutes. I walked half a block to the restaurant and waited no more than three minutes before my food was ready. I love nothing more than fast service on a late night after a long day at work. 

I wanted to order the Pork Lo Mein, which wasn't on the menu. I explained to them what I wanted and they said no problem! The food is pretty standard greasy chinese food, but to a better degree. The pork was delicious and tender and the veggies in my noodles were not over cooked at all. The noodles were pretty standard. Overall, very good flavors. The service and the food cannot be beat for the price. 

Bottom line, if you are in SOMA and in need of Chinese, 7 Mission is your best bet.
author: Blond E.

description: Agree with the other favorable reviews.  Gave them 4 stars b/c decent Chinese food in SOMA, that delivers, & for me was @30min.  Very important when laid up with a cast & can't get around.  The pork chow fun was surprisingly good.  shrimp w/bok choy wasn't bad, @average.  & prices are just right.
author: Bugsy D.

description:
I live just around the corner from 7 Mission. I resort to coming here when I'm too lazy to travel for some cheap Chinese food.  I'd get it delivered, but I can't be THAT lazy.
